active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group debate, argue whether absolute session timeouts should be 15 minutes or 8 hours for a high-security application like online banking. Support your position with OWASP ASVS v3.0.0 requirements (e.g., V3-8) and usability data from sources like NIST SP 800-63B, considering security vs. user experience trade-offs.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in OWASP-aligned content. Topic: Session Invalidation Verification (Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > 008_Application Security > Web 008_Application Security > 005_Session Management > Session Lifecycle Management > Session Invalidation Verification). Consensus: 82.9% approval from 7 voters. Incorporate these pedagogical elements: - Learning Objectives: [REMEMBER: Define key terms... CREATE: Design test case...] Ensure flashcards map to these (label each with Bloom's level). - Active Learning: Weave in discussion (timeout debate), peer teaching (mechanisms teach-back), problem-solving (Juice Shop testing) as hints/examples in explanations. - Scaffolding: Distribute flashcards across 4 layers (Foundation: basics; Components: OWASP ASVS/WSTG; Implementation: testing/code; Integration: advanced/auth links). Label each with layer. Use this Flashcard Schema exactly: - Output 25 JSON flashcards as an array of objects. - Each: {'front': 'Q (MCQ with A/B/C/D options)', 'back': {'correct_answer': 'Letter + full explanation (cite OWASP) + active learning tie-in', 'distractors': [{'option': 'Text', 'why_wrong': 'Explanation + ref'} x3]}, 'bloom_level': 'e.g., Apply', 'layer': 'e.g., 3', 'tags': ['array of 3-5 relevant tags']} - Distractors: Plausible, common errors (e.g., confuse idle/absolute timeout); balanced types. - Content Sources: OWASP ASVS v3.0.0 (V3-8 reqs), WSTG (SESS-05/07), Juice Shop examples, Burp Suite. Definitions: Web session (HTTP state), ID (unique link), invalidation (terminate on logout/timeout/pw change). Generate comprehensive set covering all objectives/layers. Ensure measurable, active recall (no pure definitions). Vary difficulty.
